name: Global Image
summary: A GI file is a disk image created by older disc-authoring software, such as Sonic RecordNow or Roxio Easy Media Creator. It contains an exact copy of the data from a CD or DVD, including the files and folders stored on the original disc, as well as its structure and formatting information. Users typically create GI files to back up discs, burn copies, or transfer disc contents to a computerâ€™s hard drive.
